name: 500 LPH RO System

specifications.recoveryRate: Typically around 50-75%, meaning it can recover 50-75% of the input water as pure water.
specifications.membrane: High-quality RO membranes designed to remove up to 99% of dissolved solids.
specifications.pump: High-pressure pump to force water through the RO membrane.
preFilters: Sediment Filter: Removes larger particles like sand, silt, and dirt.
Carbon Filter: Removes chlorine and organic impurities.
specifications.postFilters: Additional filtration stages after the RO membrane for polishing the water.
specifications.frame: Stainless steel frame for durability and corrosion resistance.
specifications.controlPanel: User-friendly control panel with pressure gauges, flow meters, and control switches.
specifications.electricalRequirements: Typically 220V/50Hz or as per region-specific requirements.
specifications.dimensions: Varies by manufacturer, but usually compact enough to fit in a small industrial space.
specifications.automaticShutOff: System shuts down when the storage tank is full.

benefits: High Purity Water: Removes up to 99% of contaminants including dissolved salts, bacteria, and viruses.
Cost-Efficient: Reduces the cost of purchasing bottled water or other purified water sources.
Environmentally Friendly: Reduces plastic waste from bottled water.
Improved Taste and Quality: Provides clean, fresh-tasting water free of impurities.
Versatile Applications: Suitable for industrial, commercial, and institutional use.
Low Maintenance: Requires minimal maintenance with periodic filter and membrane replacements.
Scalability: Can be integrated into larger systems or scaled down for smaller applications.
Energy Efficient: Modern systems are designed to be energy-efficient, reducing operational costs.
description: The 500 LPH RO system is an efficient and reliable solution for businesses, industries, and institutions requiring a consistent supply of high-quality purified water.
